segments.text: Why did he invite her?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why does that bother you?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's been three years.  Why all of a sudden?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well maybe- maybe he just wanted to see her again.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody comes seven hundred miles just to see.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you mean?  He was brought up next door to the girl his whole life.  Why shouldn't he want to see her again?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Don't look at me like that.  He didn't tell me anymore than he told you.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's not going to marry him.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know he's even thinking about it?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: It's got that about it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Well so what.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: What's going on here, Joe?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Listen kid.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: No, line.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Uh, Then why is she still-she's not his girl, Joe
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: She's not his girl, Joe.  She knows she's not.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: You can't read her mind.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Then why is she still single?  New York is full of men.  Why hasn't she married?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Probably a hundred people told her she's foolish but she's waited.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: How do you know why she waited?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because she knows what I know that's why.  She's faithful as a rock.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: In my worst moments, I think of her waiting and I know again that I'm right.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Look it's a nice day.  What are we arguing for?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Nobody in this house dares take her faith away, Joe.  Strangers might but not his father, not his brother.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What do you want me to do?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I want you to act like he's coming back, both of you.  Don't think I haven't noticed you since he invited her.  I won't stand for any nonsense.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: But Kate-
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Because if he's not coming back, I'll kill myself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Laugh, laugh at me, but why did that happen the very night she came back?
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: She goes to sleep in his room and his memorial breaks in pieces.  Look, look at it.  Joe-
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Believe with me, Joe.  I can't stand alone.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just last week a man showed up in Detroit missing longer than Larry.  You read it yourself.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Alright.  Alright.  Calm yourself.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: You above all have got to believe.  You.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: Why me above all?
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: Just don't stop believing.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What does that mean, me above all?  Look at you.  You're shaking.
segments.speaker: M

segments.text: I can't help it.
segments.speaker: F

segments.text: What have I got to hide?  What the hell is matter with you Kate?
segments.speaker: M
